contentrichtext.text: {{infobox royalty | name = King Kao of Zhou<br/>周考王 | succession = King of China | reign = 440–426 BC | predecessor = [[King Si of Zhou]] | successor = [[King Weilie of Zhou]] | issue = [[King Weilie of Zhou]] | full name = [[Chinese ancestral name|Ancestral name]]: [[Ji (surname)|Jī]] (姬)<br/>Given name: Wéi (嵬) | house = [[Zhou Dynasty]] | father = [[King Zhending of Zhou]] | death_date = 426 BC }} '''King Kao of Zhou''' ({{zh|c=周考王|p=Zhōu Kǎo Wáng}}) was the thirtieth king of the [[Chinese people|Chinese]] [[Zhou Dynasty]]<ref>Phương Thi Danh (2001), ''Niên biểu lịch sử Trung Quốc''</ref> and the eighteenth of Eastern Zhou.<ref>''Zen Baggage: A Pilgrimage to China'' by [[Bill Porter]]</ref> His personal name was '''Wéi'''. King Kao’s father was [[King Zhending of Zhou|King Zhending]], son of the [[King Yuan of Zhou]].<ref>''The Cambridge history of ancient [[China]]: from the origins of civilization to 221 B.C.'' Written by Michael Loewe.</ref> Kao fathered [[King Weilie of Zhou]], whose reign started in 426 BC, after Kao’s death. His grandson was [[King An of Zhou]].<ref>''[[Records of the Grand Historian]]'' by [[Sima Qian]]</ref> == References == {{Reflist}} {{Start}} {{S-hou|[[Zhou Dynasty]]||||426 BC}} {{S-reg}} {{S-bef|before=[[King Si of Zhou]]}} {{S-ttl|title=[[List of Chinese monarchs|King of China]]|years=440–426 BC}} {{S-aft|after=[[King Weilie of Zhou]]}} {{S-end}} {{Kings of Zhou}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = King Kao of Zhou | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = King of Zhou Dynasty China | DATE OF BIRTH = | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = 426 BC | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Kao of Zhou, King}} [[Category:426 BC deaths]] [[Category:Zhou Dynasty kings]] [[Category:5th-century BC rulers]] [[Category:Year of birth unknown]] {{China-bio-stub}}
